direction.raw_text: a long hallway. Even darker than the bedroom. And without the boys rhythmic breathing, even quieter. A window at the end of the hall enlarges as we approach. Someone is standing in front of it. The murky silhouette of the figure turns and walks away. We follow it, tentative. Turning a corner, we see the figure. Standing in a doorway. Now we can make out the edges of the person. It is an old woman. Hair in a Victorian bun. A corseted dress. She stares at us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: play out to the shrill screams of George Crumb's `Black Angels I: Night Of The Electric Insects'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eyes flick open. A woman blinks awake, gazing around the room. Another bedroom. Sparse. Just a bed and a cabinet. It is 5.43 AM. Her eyes settle on the man lying next to her in the dark. His heaving snores have woken her up. She is RENAI (pronounced Renee) LAMBERT (36). With a quiet determination she is holding on to her youthful good looks, but the lines of age are creeping in. She has settled into the `comfort' years of a marriage: hair pinned up messily, wearing dowdy pajamas. She beholds her husband, taking him in. Considering him. He snorts and smacks his lips. Very unflattering. She climbs out of bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM, LAMBERT HOME - NIGHT High ceilings. Exposed beams. Spanish style windows. Renai treads across wooden floorboards into a sunken living room. No matter careful she is, there is a loud creak with each step. A GRANDFATHER CLOCK in the corner ticks steadily. There is barely any furniture in here, only a BOOKCASE and a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What there is a lot of...is boxes. Large moving boxes. Renai plops cross-legged onto the floor and rips open one of the boxes, marked BOOKS. She plucks out a handful of books and lines them up on the bookshelf. Then another handful. They are all self-help and self-improvement books. Titles like `Be The Better You' and `Inch By Inch, It's A Cinch: A Guide To Achieving Your Goals' pop out. She spots a sealed box labelled PHOTO ALBUMS. She strips away the tape and wrestles out a dusty album of wedding photos. Smiling faces greet her as she thumbs through the pages. The happy couple. Young. Glowing. Sadness washes over her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Mom? She snaps out of it and turns to see DALTON LAMBERT (8). Her son. He approaches her, rubbing his eyes. (It is not the boy we saw in the opening scene.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing up, kiddo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like my room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll get used to it. It's only your first night. He climbs into her lap. She bites on his ear playfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Argh, I'm going to eat you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you looking at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just some photos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What photos? She hefts another album from the box, prying it open. A photo of a grinning young girl greets them, hair in pigtails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know who that is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't look like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I'm so happy there. But it's me. When I was your age. I was a kid once too, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you weren't. Renai bursts out laughing. She is famous for her big laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. Maybe you're right...I don't remember being this person at all. I hope she smiled like that all the time, whoever she was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She sizes up her son. The living embodiment of the photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a terrible thing to admit, Dalton, but sometimes I get jealous of you. That you're so young. That you haven't made any of your decisions yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't wanna grow old.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it starts happening to us from the moment we're born. She points to the hands on the grandfather clock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every time that clock ticks, we all get a little bit older. She turns the page in the photo album, seeing an old man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's your grandpa. You wouldn't remember him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smells like smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...good memory. He did smoke that god awful pipe, didn't he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show me a picture of dad when he was a little kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't even know if we have any. He's hopeless with keeping photos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show me a picture of me when I was a little kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your pictures are all in the computer. Nobody keeps photo albums like this anymore, they're ancient relics. They should. I like being able to touch something, instead of it floating around in cyber world. If the laptop breaks, your whole existence is erased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was I like when I was a little kid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are a little kid. She kisses him on the forehead and stares into his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If only you knew what I know. We hear a baby crying off screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You certainly didn't cry as much as your little sister does. Come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN, LAMBERT HOME - MORNING Chaos. Boxes of dinnerware have not been unpacked yet and it is turning the usual morning routine into a nightmare. Renai is on the phone as her kids buzz around a kitchen island at top speed, creating a high-energy, manic pace in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billing department. Her son FOSTER (6), tugs on her leg, holding a box of cereal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need a bowl, mom. Renai rips open a box, rifling through newspaper, phone wedged against her shoulder. She holds out a cup, flustered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billing department.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too small.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make it work. (INTO PHONE) Speak to an agent. Speak to an agent. Speak to an agent. Foster slumps on the floor, pouring cereal and overflowing milk into the cup. A baby girl in a high chair, CALI (2), squeals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BATHROOM, LAMBERT HOME - MORNING JOSH LAMBERT (37) gapes into the mirror, face covered in soap. He washes it off. Now he's awake we see that he is a handsome, clean-cut guy - a former high school nerd who got revenge by growing into his body. He sorts through a box labelled JOSH'S BATHROOM STUFF. He takes out two bottles - TONER and MOISTURIZER. He dabs the toner on, then smooths the moisturizer into his forehead and around his eyes. He suddenly notices a grey hair. Looks mortified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Michael Corleone voice) Every time I think I've pulled you out...you grow back in. He plucks it out, wincing melodramatically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ouch!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN, LAMBERT HOME - MORNING Josh strides in, tie hanging open around his neck. Renai is still on the phone. Josh points to his tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'd like to keep the old number if I could. (TO JOSH) You really need to learn how to do this, honey. She threads the tie into a knot for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't eat on the floor, buddy. Foster stays where he is, slurping cereal from the cup. Dalton is playing a handheld videogame. Intensely focused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, well, please let me know by the end of today, I have to give the number out. Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She hangs up, pissed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Foster, get up. Now. Foster frowns and obeys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come you were up so early? Was Cali crying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You woke me up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were snoring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I wasn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you were.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't snore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father snored. I do not snore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How would you know what you do? You're asleep. Renai marches out of the room. Dalton's game unit beeps loudly and he pumps his fist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! I made it to the last level! Invisiworld! Ever amiable, Josh high five's his son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good one, champ. (BEAT) I don't snore, do I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM, LAMBERT HOME - CONTINUOUS Renai sees that all the books she unpacked earlier are now scattered across the floor of the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are my bleeping pills?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN, LAMBERT HOME - CONTINUOUS Renai charges in. Josh snatches an apple out of a fruit bowl, biting into it. He quickly gags and spits it out into the sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the heck is this? Wax?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me get this straight - we have no actual fruit but we have wax fruit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is dangerous. It could kill one of our kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are my pills, Josh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably where you left them, Renai. She finds them on the counter, snatching them up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not where I left them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, I need my lunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, geez. Look, just...take last night's dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She opens the fridge. It is bare except for a box of sushi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sushi? Aw, that's weirdo food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all we have. Just for today, honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Check it first, Dalton. It's probably made out of Styrofoam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And while I've got you, if you're going to look at my books, please don't leave them all over the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't touch your books. Josh streaks past, kissing Renai on the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you taking the boys to school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well can you pick them up after school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I have stuff I wanted to... She trails off. He's gone. Foster BURPS. Loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I have another cup, mom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Noisy students settle into their desks. Inner city kids, mostly Hispanic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Josh is their teacher, scribbling on the blackboard. One student, a lanky boy, ALANSO (16), hovers near the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alanso, please sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No entiendo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sientate, por favor. Alanso takes a seat. Josh is having trouble getting control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on guys, quieten down. A pretty girl in the front, TERI, is annoyed at the class.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better all shut up. She commands respect. They do. Except for one kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just cos you're in love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Teri. Today we are going to talk about Darwin. It's a city in Australia, but it's also the last name of which famous naturalist?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charles Darwin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Correct. Does anybody know what he is famous for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said that people descended from monkeys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Half right. He wrote a seminal book that explained his theories on natural selection, and how the different species on this planet - including humans - evolved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know I didn't evolve from no monkey. Shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Everyone laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Humans actually have a lot in common with monkeys, or more specifically, chimpanzees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you do, but I was created in the image of my Dios. He takes a gold cross hanging on a necklace out of his shirt, kissing it and holding it up. That gets another laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I respect your right to believe that, Alanso. But I want to give you all possible theories. I want this class to go out into the world with an informed opinion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The theory is incorrect, Mr. Lambert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can it be incorrect? It's a theory. A scientific theory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, science is bullshit. We didn't get here cos of no test-tubes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alanso, if you keep talking like that I'm going to ask you to visit the principal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. He gets up and leaves as the class JEERS and BOOS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM, LAMBERT HOME - DAY Peace and quiet at last. Renai gropes in behind the bookcase, plucking a hidden jewelry box free. She pinches a cigarette out of it and lights it. She sits down at her piano, feeling the keys, warming her fingers up. Sunlight streams in through the windows. She takes out a notebook, filled with scribbled handwriting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She places the notebook on the sheetstand, then sets a small, mechanical METRONOME in motion and begins tapping out a sombre melody in time with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'm looking west, always been looking that way, gonna get it all happening, just can't do it today... She stops and makes a note in her book. She starts over, rising to the emotion of the song. She's got a good voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'm looking west, always been looking that way, I'm gonna be somebody, I just can't be her today-- She is interrupted by the tinny sound of a baby crying. She stops playing and looks over at a baby monitor, the source of the noise. Renai deflates, her shoulders sagging in defeat. She closes her notebook and leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai scoops up Cali, rocking her gently. A scratching sound interrupts. Rough. Frantic. Like a dog pawing at something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai steps into the hall, curious. She can still hear it. She follows the sound to a door. Grabs the door handle. The sound abruptly ceases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door whines open and stabs a blade of light onto a set of stairs that descend into a gloomy basement. Renai stands at the top of the stairs, squinting into the inky blackness, straining to see. She reaches up and yanks a light chain, illuminating a bare bulb and throwing light across the tenebrous space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The basement is large and completely bare. Cleaned out. Renai takes a step down. She is still carrying Cali.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: below her, we see that there is one step that is cracked and broken. She takes another step. The broken step is right below her now. One more step and she will fall. Cali squeals happily. Renai pauses...then turns around, heading back up the stairs. Stops when she sees something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...running downwards on the inside of the door...as if someone were trying to claw their way out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMBERT HOME - NIGHT A Spanish-style home. Very pretty. This is not the suburbs. More of an inner city neighborhood. There's history here. Josh pulls into the driveway of his new house in his Subaru.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM, LAMBERT HOME - NIGHT The house almost looks liveable. Foster is watching loud, zany cartoons on TV. Cali is in a high chair. Renai is folding boxes. She has unpacked most of the living room and is very tired. Josh ambles in, sees the work Renai has done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at this. Nice job. Foster bolts over and crashes into his dads legs, hugging him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa, buddy. Slow down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh, where's the box of my lamps?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. They should be here. We packed them up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I packed them. They're not here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember the movers bringing them in and putting them right there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, they're not here. I would know, I've been unpacking this stuff all day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CORRIDOR, LAMBERT HOME - NIGHT Dalton wanders the hall, sporting a red superhero CAPE and carrying a plastic, glowing light-sabre toy. He reaches a door. The basement door. He pulls it open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dalton holds up his light-sabre, the glow allowing him to make out the murky corners of the basement below. He takes a step down the stairs. Then another step. The broken step is right below him. He steps again -- -- and falls. Flails forward, tumbling down the steps, all the way to the bottom. His light sabre SHATTERS. He hits the ground, his head smacking the floor. All is dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh sits with Foster, zoned out in front of the droning TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pitch black. Dazed, Dalton sits up. His head is cut and bleeding. He is alone in the dark. He stares into the corner of the surrounding cell. His eyes adjust, making out a shape. A shadow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh and Renai look up as the quiet is shattered by a SCREAM. They spring into action, scrambling to their feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dalton? Where are you? He doesn't answer. Just keeps screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai and Josh whip the door open, glaring into the basement from the top of the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dalton? Dalton is crumpled at the bottom of the steps, sobbing, his red cape gathered around him. Renai flicks the light on. Her and Josh scamper down the steps, propping Dalton up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dalton, you have to be careful. You shouldn't be coming down here in the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you hurt the most?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My knee and my head. I can't stand up. Josh lifts him to his feet. A severely grazed knee is dotted with blood. He's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You scared us, champ. Josh carries him up the stairs as he sucks in sobs. Renai glances around the basement, her eyes landing on the lone object that resides in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She frowns. It wasn't there when she saw the basement last. It is a box. One of her large, cardboard moving boxes. It is marked LAMPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dalton is lying in bed, a band-aid slapped across his forehead. Renai tucks him in, Josh standing over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're lucky you don't need stitches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I catch you falling down the stairs again I'm gonna break your neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That doesn't make sense. There are dozens of pictures tacked to the wall, all drawn by Dalton. Josh taps one; a drawing of Dalton flying through the night sky, wearing his cape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You might be a superhero but you're not invincible. Be more careful, bud. Renai kisses him and gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sleep tight, honey. They wave goodbye and turn out the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai flops into bed beside Josh, exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've gotta lock that door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's such a boy. He goes off exploring. Sometimes I wanna keep him on one of those child leashes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why bother with a child leash? I'll stop at the pet store tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She laughs and cuddles up to him, resting her head on his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry I was pissy when you got home. I was trying to work on a song today and then Cali woke up and wouldn't stop crying...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't even notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel guilty for wanting my own time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's normal to want your own time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it? My mother gave up everything for me. I keep waiting for the completely selfless parent gene to kick in, but I'm exactly the same person I was when I was 22, only now I'm married with kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a great mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm not. They like you so much better than me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the cool dad who comes home with presents and I'm the one who yells at them all day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you're being crazy. They love you. At least you get to connect with them. I work so much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, you're their hero. They try to play us off against each other. They're master manipulators. I guess they really are my kids. Josh laughs. A lull settles over them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this it, Josh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this so bad? She doesn't answer. They sit in silence for a long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for letting me take some time off to work on my music again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll get by. I want you to do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a couple of songs...I mean not all of them, but there's a couple of them that I think are really good. And I think, maybe I could do something with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love all your songs. They kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is 3AM. All the remoteness of that hour is present here...we can feel it. As still and quiet as deep space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The formerly bustling kitchen is now a museum at midnight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long, dark thoroughfare. A ticking clock its only occupant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stairs swallowed up by darkness. The groan of settling wood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The soft breathing of a sleeping child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanging toy birds dangle over the baby, tinkling in a breeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dalton is sleeping too. Impossibly still. Lying on his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai and Josh are entwined together. Josh is snoring. They are both blissfully asleep... ...for now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another day, another chaotic breakfast. Foster waves a stuffed toy around. Josh charges in, bits of tissue on his face from shaving cuts. Cali flails her arms in her high chair. Renai is at the sink, whisking eggs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Foster, sit down honey. She whips a look around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is...? Hey Josh, could you go wake up Dalton? We FOLLOW Josh as he marches down the corridor to Dalton's bedroom, poking his head inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh knocks on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time to get up, my man. Come on. Nothing from Dalton. He doesn't even stir. Josh rolls his eyes and walks in. Nudges Dalton with his knee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're making me look bad here. Outta bed before your mother comes in and kills both of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Nothing. He's really out. Josh reaches down and shakes Dalton vigorously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dalton, get up. You've gotta get ready for school. Josh waits for a response, but none comes. Dalton is as slack as a puppet. Something resembling concern crosses Josh's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dalton...? He kneels down, shaking Dalton hard. He listens for breathing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dalton? Dalton?! DALTON!! His scream takes us into--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the stern sterility of a hospital. Josh and Renai, eyes lined by dark circles, stand in front of a dour neurologist, DR. JOEL SERCARZ (46). Renai dabs her eyes with a tissue. They are red with tears. Beyond a window in front of them, lying on a gurney in an ICU chamber, is the unconscious body of Dalton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SERCARZ Okay...as of yet, our tests have not drawn any conclusive answers for you. Repeated blood and CSF cultures are normal, making an infective origin highly unlikely. Tests for Lyme disease and repeated polymerase chain reaction are negative. Systemic vasculitis was ruled out. Dalton remains in an areactive coma without focal signs or abnormal brainstem reflexes. Josh and Renai struggle to follow the cold, multi-syllable medical terminology...like stranded tourists keeping up with a foreign language.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SERCARZ (CONT'D) We've looked for bacterial pathogens like Meningoencephalitis, but haven't seen anything. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SERCARZ (CONT'D) I wouldn't say we've exhausted every single angle...but we're close. The underlying cause is still unknown. Josh and Renai look in at their boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SERCARZ (CONT'D) The good news is that he's breathing without the use of a mechanical apparatus, and there are no lesions or hemorrhages in any of the CT scans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...there's no brain damage or...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SERCARZ None that we've detected. Technically, he's in a coma. He doesn't respond to stimuli, he has no sleep-wake cycle, but there's no brain trauma or infection. His scans are normal. To be honest, I've never seen anything like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That fall he took...I mean, it looked like he hit his head pretty hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SERCARZ We definitely exhausted that possibility, but it was always doubtful. The cut was superficial, there wasn't even a skull fracture.

direction.raw_text: : TWO MONTHS LATER INT. DALTON'S BEDROOM, LAMBERT HOME - DAY A ghastly meld of hospital room and young boys bedroom. Dalton lies on his bed, a heart rate monitor hooked to his chest. IV tubes run into his arms, a Nasogastric feeding tube into his mouth. A young nurse, ADELE CHALFIN (30), checks the various tubes as Renai watches on.

direction.raw_text: the babies room. She stares into the crib...at her other sleeping baby. She sets the baby monitor and walks out softly.

direction.raw_text: Renai slumps in front of her piano. Taps one of the keys. She plays a discordant melody of low notes with one hand, not present enough to hear it. She stops and buries her face in her hands. Then she hears it. Whispering. It's so low you would miss it if the house wasn't absolutely silent. Renai looks up, scanning for the source of the murmur. It is coming from the baby monitor. Confused, Renai picks up the monitor, turning up the volume all the way up. The hissssssss of static fills the room. She presses her ear to the device, then hears it again - a hushed WHISPER, almost indistinct from the static save for the whistle of sibilants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They see us...all of us...we have to be quick...this life begs us to come back. The whisper trails off....more static...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!!!!! Renai drops the baby monitor, leaping out of her skin at the sound of the scream. Nerves fried. The monitor smashes on the floor. All is quiet. Renai moves to the door, staring down the corridor at the door to Cali's nursery. It is open only a crack. She hears crying. Cali is crying. We follow her as she bolts towards the nursery, smashing through the door, eyes filled with terror, seeing-- --nothing.

direction.raw_text: Renai stalks into the room. The room is empty, save for Cali, crying in her crib. Renai's eyes land on the closet.

direction.raw_text: Through a slight crack, we see Renai approach. Breath quivering. Her hand reaches out. She FLINGS the door open. It is empty.

direction.raw_text: Dadda! Josh looks up, smiling. Amazed.

Foster lies in bed beneath a large chart of the solar system. Renai stops cleaning when she finds a certificate, crumpled next to a school bag. It says IN RECOGNITION OF SCIENCE SKILL, AWARDED TO FOSTER LAMBERT ON 3/14/10.

direction.raw_text: What's this?

direction.raw_text: Stay here. He gets up.

direction.raw_text: Hello? Who's there? Only the wind replies. He aims the flashlight at the glass, shining it into the thick darkness. There is no one on the front step. Josh presses the flashlight against the window, arcing the beam across his front garden. Leans in close to the glass...

direction.raw_text: Nothing. There's no one there. He makes sure the door is locked, then flips open a security system panel on the wall, pecking at the buttons on it.

direction.raw_text: Renai sits up in bed, listening. Hears nothing... ...until the low moans of a baby crying float out of the baby monitor. Renai hurls the sheet aside.

direction.raw_text: Renai pads down the hall, tentative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She reaches the open door to Cali's room. Sees the silhouette of Josh standing over Cali's crib. Exhales with relief.

direction.raw_text: There's someone in there! She RUNS towards Josh.

direction.raw_text: There's someone in Cali's room! Josh BOLTS down the hall, flicking on the light, terrified. The nursery is empty. Cali is sleeping. Terrified, Josh enters the room. Scans around. Only toys and colorful wallpaper. He steps in further. He's not cut out for this.

direction.raw_text: !!!!!! SHRIEEEEEEEEEEEEEEK!!!!! The house alarm screams to deafening life, shaving a few years off Josh's life in the process. He JOLTS, whipping around.

direction.raw_text: Grab Cali and Foster! Josh charges down the hall into the--

direction.raw_text: snatching up a fire poker from the fireplace and continuing--

direction.raw_text: to the front door, which is swinging open. Holding the fire poker aloft, Josh scans the area. Renai races past, carrying Cali and dragging Foster behind her. They barrel toward Dalton's room.

direction.raw_text: Josh scans the kitchen. It is empty. The alarm wails in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh inches his way up the hall, hand shaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai holds Foster and Cali close to her. Dalton is lying behind them. Directly across from Dalton's room is the laundry. The door is ajar, offering a view into the darkened room beyond. Renai sees something in the dark...a figure. A boy. It looks like Dalton. He reaches out to Renai-- --until another HAND...a pale hand...reaches across and shuts the laundry door, sealing the boy off from her view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh! The laundry!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh bolts up the hall, panicked. He reaches the laundry door, grabbing the handle. Hesitates. He propels the door open with a shove, flicking on the light. The room is empty. No windows, no doors for escape...just a washing machine and a dryer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMBERT HOME - NIGHT A home security officer trudges down the steps of the house. Renai, Josh, Foster and Cali all stand outside in their pajamas, shivering in the frigid night air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no one in there, it's all clear. If someone was there, they're gone now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Renai steps away from the children, out of their earshot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw somebody.

direction.raw_text: Maybe it was a shadow...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It wasn't a shadow, it was a man. He was tall, and he long, greasy hair. He was wearing a grey jacket. He looked right at me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, like I said...he's gone now. Renai looks to the others. Sees only disbelieving faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh's students scuffle about on stadium seating, arranging themselves for a CLASS PHOTO. They're not doing a great job. A male photographer does his best to compose them, not doing a great job of hiding his bitterness about the fact that he's shooting school photos instead of Vanity Fair spreads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, face the front ladies and gentlemen...come on...hold still... (muttering to himself) I'm trying to record the peak of your pathetic lives here. Josh stands off to the side, lost in his own thoughts. Tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Lambert, would you like to step in please? Josh snaps out of his own head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh...what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could you step in so that we can take the photo? Quickly please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just take it without me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need you in the photo, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you don't. Just take the damn photo without me, okay? The class settles down, shocked by the outburst. Chastened, the photographer turns to the class, gripping the camera trigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe this is my life. (beat; to class) Ready kids? Say asshole teacher!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The students file out of the gym. Josh sits in the bleachers, head buried in his hands.

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I hear things. Josh looks up, seeing Alanso.

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I spend so much time in the office, I hear things. I heard about your son. I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Alanso.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Times like these...people realize that science doesn't have all the answers. There is a higher force at work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I had your belief. Things would be a lot simpler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things are simple. You just can't see it. Put your faith in Him. He places his gold cross necklace in Josh's hand, then leaves. Josh watches him go, then takes out his cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey...I just found out I have to stay back tonight and finish off mid-term grades. It could be a while, there's a lot to go through. Don't wait up. Bye.

direction.raw_text: Josh sits on a park bench, staring into the distance. He takes out a flask of whisky, swigging from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai lies in bed, staring at the ceiling. Alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai shuffles in, pouring herself a glass of water. Then she hears it. A low muttering. It is coming from Dalton's room.

direction.raw_text: Unnerved, Renai peers through the open door. Josh is sitting beside Dalton's bed, reading to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men all walked down to the waters edge...and they stood there and asked the beast to come forth. And the beast roared back "No!". And so they dived in after it...

direction.raw_text: . LAMBERT HOME In the sunlight, the house looks like a happy place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dalton's face is a picture of serenity. A new day-shift nurse, KELLY (29), checks on his feeding tube. Renai watches from the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was going to head off for an hour or so. Are you alright here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. Anything from Dalton?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'm sorry. Renai nods. Her eyes brim with tears. The cracks are showing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep providing him with stimuli. I've seen it work time and time again. Read to him. Even if you're doing something else, you can play him music that he likes. Don't give up. She throws a scarf over her shoulder and stands.

direction.raw_text: I won't, I just...I haven't slept much the last couple of nights. I feel like the universe is trying to see how far I can bend before I break.

direction.raw_text: The universe picked a fight with the wrong chick.

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Kelly. You're a saint.

direction.raw_text: No, I'm not. I'm doing my job. I chose to be here. You didn't choose any of this. You're the strong one.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Water cascades out of a faucet. Steam rises from the water.

direction.raw_text: . Renai lets bath salts fall into the tub. She almost looks relaxed just smelling them. She starts to undress, then turns -- -- and YELPS in fright. A person is standing behind the distorted glass window, staring in at her. The shape of the person's head and shoulders can clearly be seen, but the glass is too opaque to make out any features. Renai slips, grabbing the sink. When she glances up, the figure is gone. Trembling, Renai opens the window. Very, very slowly. It is fifteen feet off the ground, with a sheer drop below it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAMBERT HOME - NIGHT Renai sits on the front steps, alone. It is late. She looks somehow tired and wired at the same time. Smoking a cigarette. Josh pulls in. Fumbles out of his car, tipsy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's midnight, Josh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did you start smoking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've been coming home late every single night. You've never had to do that in all of the years you've been at the school. Now all of a sudden you have to stay back late?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like it either, but I'm grading tests. What choice do I have? We've gotta pay Dalton's bills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother is paying Dalton's bills, Josh. I know because she reminds me every chance she gets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, I can't win with you. That's my son in there too, not just yours! He paces, the anger sobering him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've always felt like less than good enough for you. I feel it every time you mention our bills. That subtle voice that says `can't you get a job that pays more than a teacher'? And now I can't even look at you without feeling it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're projecting that onto me. You've written an entire story about I'm how I'm feeling without once asking me how I'm feeling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need to ask. I know you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am losing my mind here in this house, Josh. I'm scared and I need you and you're not here. Where are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, I'm grading tests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't mean that. I mean you're not here. With me. In this situation. You're avoiding it, like you do anything stressful, whether it's this or a parking ticket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, I should have stayed at the school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you go again. Renai stands up and walks inside the house. The door closes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh tosses a pillow onto the couch, setting himself up for the night. He curls up on it, pulling a blanket over himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The witching hour. Still. Quiet...save for the omnipresent clock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dalton is as still as we've seen him. And then...he twitches. A slight facial twitch, but we see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh snoozes, head arched at a bad angle. His back will regret sleeping on this couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai tosses and turns, restless in sleep. Her eyes open and she sucks in a breath. Bad dreams. She blinks and looks around the room, surprised to be alone, sitting up in fright. Until she remembers why. She eases back onto the bed. Then she looks over at the window. There is a man standing outside it. He is not looking in at her...he is pacing back and forth, furiously smoking a cigarette. Back and forth, back and forth. Agitated. He has long, black, greasy hair and a grey jacket. Every muscle in Renai's body freezes. She becomes a glacier. Her eyes are drilled to the man, unable to move. By sheer will, she manages to direct them towards the bedroom door. Opens her mouth but no words will come. Finally--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jo....osh....Josh....Josh... She glances back at the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He paces back and forth between the bed and the window, just as he was outside, ignoring Renai. Smoking like a fiend. And then, suddenly, he stops pacing. Looks up. Straight at Renai - as if just realizing she was there.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE MAN IS NOW IN THE ROOM

direction.raw_text: . For a moment their eyes are locked in silence... ...and then the man's face contorts in anger and he CHARGES towards her, arms outstretched, GROWLING in fury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Renai lets out a SHRIEK of terror that could strip paint. A cry from the depths of her soul. She propels herself backward, falling off the bed and scrambling back into the corner. Josh CHARGES into the room, flicking on the light-- --seeing only Renai, huddled in the corner, screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? What is it?! Renai is incoherent. She cannot stop screaming. Josh grabs her by the shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai, what is wrong?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man -- he was there -- he tried to -- there was a man there!!! Foster runs into the room, visibly terrified. He sees his mother and instantly begins crying. He runs to his dad, holding onto his leg. In the background, Cali begins crying, her screams contributing to an overwhelming din.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no one here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw somebody!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no one here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you dare not believe me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe you, okay? I just don't know what you want me to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to tell me that we can leave this house. I will not spend one more night here. I wanna leave, I wanna go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want the man to get me. The realization that her child is terrified quiets Renai. All is suddenly silent, save for the cries of Cali in the background. Josh holds his son tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're okay, buddy. I've got you. He and Renai exchange a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. (BEAT) I can't...I want to leave this house. I can't be here anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To move now would be...we would have to rent somewhere. It's not--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Josh. An agreement passes between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A moving truck is parked outside an average suburban home. Movers mill about, hauling boxes and couches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai unpacks boxes. An elderly woman, LORRAINE (65), helps to unpack. This is Josh's mother. She has a curt, disapproving manner about her that doesn't always make her easy to love. She is actually moving more quickly than Renai, who groans as if her back were aching as she stoops down to pick up books.

direction.raw_text: Lorraine, you shouldn't have to do any of this. Sit down.

direction.raw_text: Nonsense. I'm perfectly capable of putting a few things away. I did it for Josh his whole life. He never was good with tidying up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, but I just feel so bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's you who should be sitting down by the looks of it. She boosts a photo frame from one of the boxes. It is a portrait of Renai, Dalton, Foster and Josh. In happier times. Lorraine seems taken aback by it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe you got Josh to sit still for a photo. Renai reclines against the wall, surveying her new living room. Her new new house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe we're doing all this again, that's what I can't believe. (beat; looks at her) I know you think I'm crazy. Lorraine stops unpacking and fixes Renai with a stare. They've never really gotten along before. Adversity has brought about a truce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody - not me, not anybody - knows what you're going through right now. Whatever you have to do to get through it, do it. And never apologize for it. Renai hugs her. It's a new thing for them and a bit awkward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRYCE TRIMBLE (52) sits opposite Renai and Josh. Spread out in front of him are a series of X-Rays, labelled DALTON LAMBERT. His office is big and expensive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Renai looks hopeful. Josh looks like a shell of a man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We just wanna say...thank you so much. For helping us out with this, doctor. We can't tell you how much it means to have you involved.

direction.raw_text: . TRIMBLE I'm glad to help. (BEAT) Unfortunately...these recent tests have proven inconclusive. There's absolutely nothing abnormal here. Josh and Renai deflate.
