direction.raw_text: So...if you're the top of the food chain with this stuff, where does that leave us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TRIMBLE I don't know. There is a research team in Boston who specialize in a new form of treatment. They try to stimulate the patients brain with electric pulses. It has a good success rate with victims of brain injury. We could try that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So there's hope?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TRIMBLE There are more things we can try. (BEAT) The hope part is up to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai sits beside Dalton. Staring at him. She runs her fingers through his hair, touching his skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A needle touches an LP. The pops and crackles of record hiss spit forth, followed by the lilting guitar strums of `Tip Toe Through The Tulips'. The quavering falsetto of Tiny Tim accompanies the guitar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FROM RECORD) Tip-toe by the window, by the window, that is where I'll be... Renai walks away and we follow her down the hall into -- INT. FOSTER'S BEDROOM, NEW HOUSE - CONTINUOUS -- a mess as only a child can make. Renai picks up a plate and a fork and knife from the floor. She walks out and we DON'T CUT, tracking with her -- INT. HALLWAY, NEW HOUSE - CONTINUOUS -- back down the hall, towards the kitchen. The records continues warbling in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh tip-toe, from the garden, by the garden, of the willow tree... Renai passes the living room. What she doesn't see is the child standing in the middle of the room, facing the record player. The boy is dressed in clothes from another time, but children's clothes just the same. He is dancing awkwardly, shifting his weight from one foot to foot the other sheepishly, as if trying it for the first time. Renai keeps walking and we stay with her as she moves past the child, following her into the -- INT. KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS -- mess of the kitchen. She sets the plate down in the sink, on top of a stack of other dirty dishes. With a sigh she runs the hot water over the dishes. With a sudden POP, the record starts skipping. Bump...bump...bump...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Renai shuts off the water, heading back to the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She marches in, annoyed. Then freezes. Her bookshelf is empty. The books that once sat on it are now scattered across the floor. Bump...bump...bump... Renai scans the books.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it... Giggling. She pivots her head towards the darkened hallway. There, she sees a child, hidden in shadow, standing in the hall. Staring at her. Bump...bump...bump... Renai doesn't move. Doesn't breathe. And then suddenly, the child turns and runs down the hall, disappearing into Dalton's bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God, Dalton...no... Summoning every ounce of strength, Renai troops down the hall towards Dalton's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai pushes the door open. Dalton lies in the center of the room on his gurney. The only sound is his breathing. Renai surveys the room. It is empty. Bump...bump...bump... She steps inside, glancing over at a cabinet. In the foot- high space beneath it, a small white shoe protrudes slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A child's shoe. Heart pounding, Renai bends down, peering into the darkness under the cabinet. Bump...bump...bump... The shoe does not have a foot in it. It is simply a discarded shoe. There is no one under the cabinet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cabinet doors EXPLODE open as the child bursts out, giggling. Only we see that it is not a child. It is a DWARF. A man in child's clothing. The dwarf runs past Renai as she LEAPS back. He runs out of the room, giggling. All is quiet again. Bump...bump...bump... Renai gets up, unsure of what to do. Numb with terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the record pitches back to life, the volume startling. Renai JOLTS, falling backwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A darkened class room. An older janitor, NED (68), shoulders the door open, carrying a mop. He STARTS when he sees Josh, sitting at his desk in the pale light of a desk lamp. Alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh...didn't see you there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to scare you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you up to this late? Josh holds up his flask of whisky. He's a bit soused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did all the bartenders who listen to your troubles go, Ned? Ned nods sagely. He sets down his mop and grabs a chair, sitting in front of Josh with a sigh. He takes the flask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never drink alone. If you take the dirty jokes out of drunkenness, all you're left with is the self loathing. He downs a hit from the flask, then hands it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need whisky for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bah. You people think too much. Used to be, if life threw a shitstorm at you, you'd grab the nearest umbrella. Your generation would spend a day googling what brand to buy. Josh laughs despite himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I probably would too. (beat; takes a drink) It's funny, I've always known I was the type of person that things didn't happen to. I made peace with it. I thought to myself, it's okay - I'll never win the lottery or climb Mount Everest...but I'll never get a rare tropical blood disease either. It works out. (BEAT) Now I'm the guy whose son is in a mysterious coma.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things happen to everybody. Even to good people like you. And they're gonna keep happening the older you get, believe me. No use sittin' in the dark drinkin' over it. Go home. Be with your wife. Tell her your what's on your mind. He takes the flask and has another swig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There sure as hell isn't any umbrellas `round here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh pulls up to the house. Turns off the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . An old Cadillac is sitting in the driveway. Josh clambers out of his car and peers in through the window of the Cadillac, quizzical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai is huddled on the couch in the living room, gripping her knees to her chest. A man is sitting next to her; a handsome, soft-spoken Anglican priest, FATHER NATHANSON (40). Josh enters. There are subtle changes in his coordination and speech from the booze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the first line of a joke. Guy comes home to find his wife with a priest... Father Nathanson stands, as does Renai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh, this is Liam Nathanson. A very old friend of mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to meet you. I've heard a lot about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't say I've heard the same, Liam. At least I know you're not sleeping with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Don't be rude, Josh. Josh turns to see his mother, holding a tray of tea. He frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is going on here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should be going. Thank you so much for the tea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Liam. He clears his throat and exits, quickly and quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, would anyone mind telling me what the hell is going on here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please sit down, Joshua.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Joshua?" Oh Jesus...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The melodramatic way in which you two are conducting yourselves right now is scaring the shit out of me, so just tell me what's wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing is wrong. We want to talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody asks you to sit down unless something is wrong. If a doctor calls you into his office and asks you to sit down, you're fucked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no use, Lorraine. He's been drinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have not been drinking. Not enough that we can't talk to each other, Renai. And don't judge me in that bitchy tone, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He would never speak to me like that before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ. You're acting like I'm some lush who comes home and beats you with a belt. At least I'm speaking to you. You suddenly have to speak to a priest. Or my mother who, up until a couple of weeks ago, you couldn't stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're an asshole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your wife needs you. Now sit down and listen to her. I won't ask you again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Josh obeys. His mothers tone can still shut him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on, Renai. Tell him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This...thing that was in the other house. It followed us. Josh shifts in his seat. Agitated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let her speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw someone again today. In the house. It looked like a young boy. I followed it into Dalton's room... but it wasn't a child. (BEAT) This thing is here. I know it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...what? You called in a priest to get rid of it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know what else to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you kidding me? (TO LORRAINE) Was this your idea?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It was mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've never been to a church in your life. Now you're inviting a priest into our home? I feel like I don't even know you right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a fantasy, and you need a therapist, not a member of the clergy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening to Renai is real. I've seen it for myself. (BEAT) I came here today because last night I had a dream about this place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are FLOATING through the corridor, looking through Lorraine's POV. We are inside her dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I was in this house...but it was late at night. The POV keeps moving, out of the kitchen and into the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) I tried to be quiet. I didn't want to wake anybody. I was afraid. The POV floats down the hall, reaching a door. The door opens, revealing Josh and Renai, sleeping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) I looked into your bedroom. You were both asleep. The POV keeps moving down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) I knew that I was asleep in the dream...but I could feel that someone was awake in the house. We keep pushing on, reaching the door to Dalton's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) I went into Dalton's room. The door pushes open. In the dark, we can see Dalton, in bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) There was someone in there with him. The POV turns to see a DARK FIGURE, standing in the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) A man was standing in the corner of the room. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) I asked him who he was...he said he was a visitor. I asked him what he wanted...he said Dalton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lorraine is clearly unsettled by the dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can still hear that voice. She looks up at Josh - and SCREAMS! Over Josh's shoulder, crouched down behind the couch and peeking up over the armrest at Lorraine, is a DIABOLICAL FIGURE. His face is PURE RED with smeared lipstick. His scalp is completely bald, yet tufts of hair dangle above his ears. Other than his face, his skin is charcoal black. Lorraine recoils back, utterly petrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? Lorraine stares eerily into his eyes. Frozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's here. Renai looks to Josh, who is at a total loss. She is crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help us... His anger fades and he steps over and takes her in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know how.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know somebody who can help...if you're willing to ask for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A battered van is parked in the driveway of the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renai and Josh stand in front of two men. They are silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The shorter one is a wiry young man who looks like he spends most of his time in dark rooms. Not a member of the beach volleyball team. This is SPECS (32). The other is TUCKER (33), a larger man with scruffy facial hair. He is eating a Hot Pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you must be Josh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That wasn't psychic. Lorraine told me your name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Specs. (beat; spooky voice) I'm here to solve your problem. I'm just kidding with the voice. We take this very seriously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So is Elise coming or...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She won't be joining us yet. Usually we handle all the background stuff, then she gets involved when we have the facts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helps weed out the nutjobs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a little uncomfortable. Speaking for myself. I'm not used to this kind of stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We understand completely. Ninety six per cent of the people we deal with have had no experience with this type of phenomena before. He takes out a notepad and pen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would like to start by interviewing you both. Can we record your answers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah...sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My assistant will check different areas of the house for electrical anomalies. I'll get him started. Tucker, would you follow me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Specs leads Tucker into the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Assistant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could you not eat that in front of the clients?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Assistant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finish it in here. This industry gets laughed at enough as it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Specs is halfway through interviewing Josh and Renai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you or any of your children suffer from epilepsy or autism?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I mean, our son...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. I heard about this from Lorraine. He is in a coma, the cause of which is unknown?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do either of you habitually use drugs or alcohol?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No drugs at all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I take anti-depressants sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have a history of clinical depression?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a history. I've had bouts of it. In the past. Renai is uncomfortable. Specs makes a note. The camera beeps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tucker, could you check the camera?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I'm still assisting in the other room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whenever you're ready then. A long beat. Tucker finally enters, adjusts the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Renai and Josh) He handles administration, I handle technical. It's an even split. He couldn't change a light bulb and I'm no good with paperwork. It bores me senseless. Specs clears his throat, peeved. Continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have any history of sexual abuse in the family?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. (BEAT) I'm sorry, I have to ask how this relates to our problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nine times out of ten, when someone comes to us with a problem like this, it's because of an inward cause within the family unit...not a physical force outside of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Specs and Tucker mill around the room. Tucker is carrying a small electronic device. He holds it against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tri-field meter. It measures DC fields and the natural electro magnetic environment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes old wiring can leak into the atmosphere. It can cause hallucinations, changes in energy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. It's a little more complicated than that, but, you know, you get the general idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's basically that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not really, but whatever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tech stuff's not relevant to you anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's very relevant, but it's all good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tucker edges into the corridor. He switches out the light, then takes what looks like a modified VIEW-MASTER TOY out of his shoulder bag, holding it up to his eyes. He stalks down the corridor with it. All is quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THROUGH VIEWMASTER - different filters highlight different degrees of UV light. Each slide changes the readings. He approaches the grandfather clock. Another slide clicks into place - showing us TWO FIGURES. Standing beside the clock. In the negative light, they look like females. Tucker lowers the device. There is no one there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Specs packs up the video equipment, babbling to Josh and Renai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Epilepsy in one of the children mostly. It's very common. If we approach things academically, it lets us find the genuinely interesting cases. Tucker backs into the room. Very slowly. He is afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we can call Elise now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh opens the door to see an elderly woman, ELISE RAINIER (73), who despite her years maintains a sprightly energy. There is absolutely nothing morbid or dour about her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Rainier?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, my mother couldn't come, it's just me. Elise. You must be Lorraine's son? You've grown since I last saw you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last saw me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother and I have been friends for a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Elise steps inside. Renai, Tucker and Specs gather around her. Everyone becomes very subservient, like the Queen just arrived.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (re Specs and Tucker) They're very good assistants but I can't get them to dress any better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. I'm Renai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pleased to meet you. I'm Elise. Elise takes her hat off and scans the room, taking a deep breath. Tucker jabbers, eager to please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We took Tri-field and EMF readings of the whole house. All the wiring, alarm clocks, radios, toasters, TV, record player, fuse box. Nothing went off the charts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the previous home? Tucker and Specs look at each other. Oh shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tucker hadn't monitored that yet. I could jump on that this afternoon if you like? Make up for lost time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but who would work the equipment? I'll need to be there. You know what, don't even sweat it. I'll make myself available.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, that's fine, gentlemen. She stares up at the ceiling, as if seeing something they can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think bad wiring is the problem here. She drifts over to the bookshelf, her hand landing on the stack of photo albums Renai looked through in the opening scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Renai and Josh exchange a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I walk through the house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steven, do you have your sketchbook? Specs hurriedly fishes a sketchbook and pencil out of his bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I do. Yes, I do. Yes, yes. I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. We're going to need it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She tells me what she sees and I draw it. It's the most important part of her process.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His drawings and my photos comprise her visual records.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Especially the drawings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's debatable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not debatable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is, but whatever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Onwards and upwards. Find me a ghost. Elise begins walking through the house. Tucker and Specs trail her and we FOLLOW THEM into the--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Renai and Josh stay back, sheepish. Elise stalks forward at the front, surveying every nook and cranny of the house. Elise stops suddenly. She is staring straight at a corner of the hallway, next to the grandfather clock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is something here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is where I saw it. Elise calmly mutters something to Specs in a low voice, but we have trouble hearing it - only snatches of key words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...long hair...grey dress...her eyes are... He immediately starts sketching. His line drawings are fast but detailed. Impressive. He outlines the wall, the ceiling lamp, the grandfather clock. And then something else... Two young women. Standing next to the grandfather clock, dressed in Amish garb. Even in the roughness of the drawing, we can make out their pleading eyes and pale skin. Tucker takes out a camera, snaps some shots. Josh and Renai step forward, seeing the sketch. Elise keeps moving, heading straight for one door in particular. She stops, running her hand over the wood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I have permission to enter this room?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you could wait back there? Josh and Renai hug each other. Tucker lowers the camera. Elise grips the door handle and turns it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door groans open. Dalton is lying on his gurney, surrounded by the sluggish drone of hospital equipment. The curtains are drawn and the room is dark. Elise hesitates...then steps inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave the lights off. Elise steps closer to Dalton. She runs her hands over his prone body. She shivers as she does. A ripple of fear passes through her. Her breath quickens. Slowly...very very slowly ...she gazes up at a corner of the ceiling. Her eyes WIDEN and the look on her face
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Her arm raises up, her finger extending and pointing at the corner she is glaring at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? What do you see? Elise cups her hand over her mouth and whispers to Specs, keeping her eyes GLUED to the far corner of the ceiling. We cannot hear what she is whispering. Hand shaking, Specs feverishly starts to sketch. We cannot see what he is drawing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you see?! The strokes of Specs' pencil become faster and rougher, keeping up with Elise's whispers. Sweat dots his forehead. Tucker glances at the drawing and steps back instinctively. He holds up his Viewmaster.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SHOULD BE ABSOLUTE T E R R O R

direction.raw_text: THROUGH VIEWMASTER - we see the far corner of the ceiling change color as Tucker rotates the lenses inside...but nothing out of the ordinary appears. Just a ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Suddenly, Renai charges forward, snatching the sketch book. The drawing is of a hideous form - crouched in the corner of the ceiling, staring down at Dalton below. It is the RED- FACED DEMON Lorraine saw earlier. His naked body is charcoal black...whilst also strangely translucent, the veins visible underneath the flesh. A corpulent stomach juts out, as if he were pregnant. Terrified, Renai flicks on the light -- -- revealing nothing but an ordinary ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elise holds court in the living room. Renai and Josh hold each other, struggling to comprehend it all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure if you are ready to hear this yet...but unfortunately I can't waste any time easing you into it. There is no time left. She takes a deep breath, preparing herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to know that this is what I believe and it may contradict a previous medical diagnosis. However, you called me here and I am taking that as an acceptance of my readings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your son...is not in a coma. His physical body is here, but his spiritual body is not. (BEAT) The reason these disturbances followed you to a new home is because...it is not the house that is haunted. It is your son. This is too much for Josh. Renai, however, wants to listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Elise considers what she is about to say carefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you ever heard of astral projection?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of body experiences? Elise nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I call them travellers. These are people with the ability to leave their physical body and travel to different places in an astral form. To some degree, we all have the ability to do it...but most of us subconsciously suppress it or don't know how to access it. Josh shakes his head, agitated. Renai leans forward, desperate for an answer to her terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dalton is...a very accomplished astral projector. He has been since he was very young. He's not afraid of his ability. And that lack of fear has led him to travel too far and become lost...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lost? Lost where? Elise gazes up at the ceiling, as if looking into another world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In The Further.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Further is that place beyond our perception, beyond our understanding of the physical world that we can see and touch. It is a place without clocks or measurements, without past or future...an infinite realm that holds all of our dreams...and all of our nightmares. She turns to look at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is where Dalton is. Renai cries, unprepared for what she is hearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The problem is that with his astral body gone, he has left a physical body with us. An empty vessel. Josh can't meet her gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And there are entities that know this. They can smell it - the chance to live again. That is why they have gathered around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many are there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are five benevolent spirits. Five different entities for whom Dalton has become a most prized possession. They are trying to get inside his physical body...and they get closer with each passing day. Her words hang in the air like gunsmoke. Pure fear courses through Josh's eyes. He fidgets, agitated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then there are two entities who are...not benevolent. One of them takes the form of a man, the other... She holds up the drawing that Specs di.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They work together, so desperate are they to possess Dalton. They are the closest of all the entities to getting inside him. (BEAT) I don't want to scare you, but I have never, in all my years of doing this, experienced anything as terrifying as their presence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there a way to bring Dalton back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is something we could try. A way of calling him back. I would need your complete trust. Josh can't take it any more. He stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. No. This has gone too far.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said that you'd give her a chance!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have given her a chance, and I did that because I wanted to help you. But I cannot have somebody telling us that the reason our son is in a coma is because his soul is floating off somewhere in another dimension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know this is hard to hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's not fair is what it is. You're preying on people's grief and vulnerability, which is really easy to do in a situation like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did we go to all the trouble of bringing them here if you're just going to reject what they say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I wanted to help you. To put your mind at ease, and if this helped, then great. But to drag Dalton into this? No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh, you're not being fair...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fair? How did the voice of reason become the bad guy here? Don't you see? You want to believe. Of course you do, honey, anybody would. The room goes quiet. Josh turns to Elise.
direction.name: direction

Josh stoops down, picking it up. It is a drawing split into two halves. The left half is a self portrait of Dalton, lying in bed, looking down from above. At the bottom of the first drawing, Dalton has written `Last night I watched myself sleep'. A tear falls down Josh's face. He begins to cry. Deep and painful tears he has long pent up. Renai SCREAMS into the abyss as Dalton BELLOWS at them, spit flying from his throat, his tongue hanging down over his dislocated jaw. He stamps his foot and the table - and everyone sitting at it, Renai, Josh and Elise - go flying backwards as if pushed by a hurricane, smashing into the wall with crushing power. We realize that Dalton was not sitting at the table, but squatting down awkwardly. Painfully. He stands up, then steps forward. As Josh and Renai watch, his KNEE begins to BEND BACKWARDS, the tendons stretching and snapping, the knee bending in the opposite direction. His other knee follows and he steps forward - both knees bending back. Specs is rigid in his chair, rooted to the spot, notepad still in hand. When he looks up at Dalton, the flashlight under his chin shines in Dalton's eyes. Dalton ROARS and advances forward - SLAPPING Specs with the force of ten men. Specs reels backwards, hitting the wall, smashing his head and crumpling like paper. Elise stands to face Dalton. Tucker SHRINKS BACK as he captures all this with the video camera. Dalton steps forward again and Elise CHARGES at him, grabbing Dalton by the hair.

direction.raw_text: the basement. Josh screams at the Old Woman as she stares at him through what he thinks is a window. THEY HAVE SWAPPED PLACES. He is now in The Further, and she is in our world.
